thread.title_full: Uttar Pradesh elections 2017: UP polls: Akhilesh Yadav, Rahul Gandhi release Common Minimum Programme today | Uttar Pradesh Elections 2017 - Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Uttar Pradesh elections 2017: UP polls: Akhilesh Yadav, Rahul Gandhi release Common Minimum Programme today | Uttar Pradesh Elections 2017
text:
NEW DELHI: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav and Congress vice president Rahul Gandhi on Saturday released a joint list of ten commitments to the people of Uttar Pradesh . 

In order to strengthen their alliance, the two leaders together released the Common Minimum Programme (CMP) in Lucknow on Saturday. 

The 10-point commitment include some of the promises made by Rahul Gandhi during his state-wide Kisan Yatra, such as loan waiver to farmers and reduction of power tariff for them - a long time demand of Congress. Law and order, and development issues will also be enlisted in the CMP. 



Both the parties have already released their manifestos. 

While SP will have the lion's share of 298 of 403 seats, Congress will contest the remaining 105.
